intro: Myrsine umbellata f. vulgaris, commonly known as the common myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is a shrub characterized by its opposite, simple, and elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in umbels, giving it its species name. The fruits are small, round berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
